summary.p: This annotated manuscript of the Amarakośa has been bound together as a book with two other manuscripts. The folios have been bound out of order, and they have been renumbered, following the binding, from 96 onwards. Much of the original foliation has been lost due to damage, but the last folio is numbered, originally, 109.

The colophon gives a date of 1644, which Cabaton has interpreted as a Śāka date, corresponding to 1722. The colophon ends with a curse pronounced upon he who would dare steal the manuscript. Similar curses have been found at the end of other Bengali manuscripts (Shastri 2012, 29; Fleming 2015; Rāmamālā Library 1523).
This manuscript was donated to the Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-Lettres in 1877, and transferred to the BnF in the same year. In the registry of donations, the text is titled Amarābhidhāna.

niṣpāpā litā iti yāvat | yad vā anaghā hṛtyā tathā ca dharaṇiḥ anagho 'pāpahṛtyayor iti guṇyante 'ti guṇāḥ guṇa
jñānadayāsindhoḥ jñānaṃ sarvvaviṣayāvabodhaḥ paraduḥkhaprahāṇechā dayā tābhyāṃ sindhor iva iti numbhopamā sindhuśabdo 'tra vipulādhāratvād upacaritaḥ punaḥ kīdṛśasyā ti jñāna
syeti vā kimbhūtaḥ saḥ parahitāpādaneṣu nāsti kṣayo virāmo yasyety akṣayaḥ atha vā nāsti kṣayo maraṇaṃ yasyety akṣayaḥ śriye cāmṛtāya ca śrir atra trivargasampatiḥ mokṣaḥ tathā ca
